text: Lakshdweep, formerly known as the Laccadive, Minicoy and Aminidivi Islands are a group of islands in the Arabian Sea. They belong to India. Their capital is Kavaratti. It covers an area of . Eleven of the 36 coral atoll islands of Lakshadweep are inhabited. Lakshadweep is known for its exotic and sun-kissed beaches and lush green landscape. The name Lakshadweep in Malayalam and Sanskrit means 'a hundred thousand islands'. The islands are the only coral atolls in India. The people living there are Malayalam and Mahl people, who have been influenced by Arab traders. Lakshadweep is a Muslim region just like the neighbouring Maldives, where tourism is strictly regulated. Lakshadweep has the largest percentage of Muslims - 98%, even larger percentage than Jammu and Kashmir and is the only Muslim-majority Indian administrative division entirely within India. Apart from the emerging tourism, government jobs, fishing and coconut production are the mainstays of the Lakshadweep economy. ==Territorial symbols of Lakshadweep== Image:Sterna fuscata.JPG|Provincial bird of Laksahdweep Image:Bep chaetodon decussatus.jpg|Provincial animal of Laksahdweep Image:Uru-tahiti1.jpg|Provincial tree of Laksahdweep Image:|Provincial flower of Laksahdweep == Other websites == Category:Commonwealth dependent states Category:Islands of India Category:Territories of India
title: Lakshadweep
